intro: Tephrosia betsileensis, commonly known as the Betsilean tephrosia, is a flowering plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, compound leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, with a distinctive pea-like shape typical of the legume family. It plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators and contributing to soil fertility.
